content.description: The Stoned Monkey is a great route! Crux is right at the bottom. Sit start and move to a slopey crimp. Then fall back into a sweet jug. Now top out!
content.location: Routes located on a arête left of Be-Bop. Easy decent down.

content.description: Start on a big jug. Lean out and look for two pockets. The crux is moving out to a big brain like hold. Get your feet established and top out.
content.protection: 3-4 pads. The landing has a big boulder under it so pad placement is key. Bring a few spotters and a dog.
content.location: Just left of Big Sky Grit. Easy down climb left in a chimney.

content.description: Cool start on a nice jug. Move straight up the face. Crux is a small left three finger crimp. After that, hit the jug and match your hands. Get on up there.
content.protection: Bring a few pads. The landing once again has a boulder directly behind if you fall. Have some good spotters and SEND!!!
content.location: Located just up the hill from Big Sky Grit. Sit start on a nice jug hold.

content.description: Great problem in the area. Climb the arête from a sit or a stand start. Crux is in the middle holding a slopey left hand and a small crimp on your right. One high step to get you in reach of some better holds.
content.location: Picasso's Point is the obvious arête right at the end of the trail.

content.description: Cool problem with some fun moves. Start matched on a great ledge with nice feet. Move your right hand to a slopey side pull. The crux is getting to the slopey ledge straight up. Match your hands again and make your way to the top.
content.location: The start is located on the inside corner to the right of "Big Sky Grit" You can get down by down climbing or walking all the way right to an easy way down.

content.description: Awesome problem. Start on the same jug as Roadside Attraction. Now move left on some big flakes. Crux is near the top. Grab a small crimper and look up for a good jug to top out.
content.protection: 2-4 pads. Same boulder is still directly behind you if you fall. Easy to protect though.

content.description: Same start as Stoned Monkey. Instead of going right, head up left on the slabby face. Rock over on your left foot and stand up.
content.location: Crux is the sit start. Start with the two crimps and reach far left for a good side pull Now stand up and send it!

content.description: Super fun problem for all climbers. Start on the big jug under the mini roof. Climb out to another sloper jug. Crux is a high right foot to a big left hand sloper. Finish by climbing the face using holds on each side.
content.location: First problem you will come across in the area. There are a few easy ways down in the area as well.

content.description: Real fun route and great for beginners. Be-bop is the sit start going up the arête. Rocksteady is a optional top out after you top out Be-Bop. Its just a two move top out that can get the blood going!
content.protection: 1-2 pads. 2 for sure to top out Rocksteady.
content.location: Farthest right from Big Sky Grit.
